DOC.brief_summary: Although patient-ventilator asynchrony is a frequent phenomenon, its course following management is unknown. As the aid of a data recording system, we try to observe the consequence of patient-ventilator asynchrony following management. Our target is aimed at the patients with high asynchronization index ( > 10%) as this group of patients have been shown to have prolonged course in intensive care unit and are also prone to be tracheostomized
DOC.brief_title: Patient-Ventilator Dyssynchrony: How is the Effect of Management?
DOC.criteria: patients admitted to respiratory intensive care unit with acute respiratory failure and presence of patientventilator asynchrony(AI of more than 10%) patient can trigger the ventilator High oxygen fraction: > 60%.
